problems_validated.problem: Founders moved away from industry-specific software chasing broad startup concepts
problems_validated.market_gap: Lack of tailored, vertical-specific software solutions

products_tools.name: Vertical SaaS Bible
products_tools.use_case: Guide for building vertical SaaS businesses

business_strategies.strategy: Pick an industry first, not an idea - focus on industry characteristics
business_strategies.implementation: Use scientific approach to evaluate industries based on revenue size and company segmentation
business_strategies.expected_results: Better market fit and sustainable business
business_strategies.case_study: Luke's trade school SaaS generating millions

business_strategies.strategy: Target industries with healthy mix of small, mid-market, and enterprise businesses
business_strategies.implementation: Look for industries with good segmentation rather than top-heavy enterprise-only markets
business_strategies.expected_results: Easier market entry and growth path
business_strategies.case_study: Avoid industries like hospitals with only 2500 companies

business_strategies.strategy: Start with SMBs, develop features, then move up-market
business_strategies.implementation: Enter with smaller feature set for small businesses, then expand capabilities for mid-market and enterprise
business_strategies.expected_results: Gradual capability building and market expansion

problems_solutions.problem: How to select the right vertical market for SaaS
problems_solutions.solution: Use scientific approach with industry analysis checklist
steps: Map out industries by revenue size
Look for healthy mix of business sizes

startup_ideas.idea: Vertical SaaS for specific industries with good segmentation
startup_ideas.target_market: Industries with mix of small, mid-market, and enterprise businesses
startup_ideas.validation: Direct interaction with businesses in target industry
startup_ideas.investment_needed: Can be bootstrapped unlike broad SaaS

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Chasing broad startup concepts instead of focusing on specific industries
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Higher failure rate, more competition, harder to achieve product-market fit
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Focus on vertical markets and industry-specific needs
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Many founders moved away from industry-specific software in last 10-15 years

mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Requires massive feature sets and significant capital investment
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Look for industries with healthy segmentation including SMBs
mistakes_to_avoid.example: General Medical and Surgical Hospitals with only 2500 companies

growth_tactics.tactic: Start with SMBs then move up-market
steps: Enter market with minimal viable feature set
Use AI to analyze market size

metrics_kpis.benchmark: Bigger is better for venture opportunities
metrics_kpis.optimization_tip: Focus on large markets with good segmentation

metrics_kpis.benchmark: Healthy mix of small, mid-market, and enterprise

trends_signals.trend: Return to vertical SaaS after broad startup concept failures
trends_signals.opportunity: Significant opportunity in boring, industry-specific software
